properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 6 at 2:36AM PST until January 6 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
...MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW TODAY AND TONIGHT FOR THE CASCADES...
NORTHEAST WASHINGTON...BLUE MOUNTAINS...AND THE IDAHO
PANHANDLE...

.A storm system will arrive this morning with snow expanding into
many areas of Eastern Washington and North Idaho. Moderate to
heavy snow accumulations are expected and will likely impact
morning travel across the low elevations. Snow will transition to
rain for the Palouse and Spokane - Coeur D Alene Areas by this
afternoon.

* WHAT...Additional 3 to 6 inches through tonight near the Cascade
Crest. An additional 1 to 2 feet of heavy wet snow expected in
the mountains near the Cascade crest today and this evening.
Valley snow accumulations of 6 to 11 inches for upper portions
of Wenatchee River Valley and the upper Methow Valley including
Plain, Lake Wenatchee, and Mazama.

* WHERE...The Cascade Crest including Highway 2 from Coles
Corner to Stevens Pass, Plain, Lake Wenatchee, and Mazama.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, through 4 AM PST this
morning. For the Winter Storm Warning, from 4 AM to 10 PM PST
today.

* IMPACTS...Winter driving conditions are expected through
tonight with periods of moderate to heavy mountain snow.
Increasingly heavy snow will have the potential to produce
dangerous conditions Monday into Monday evening with snowfall
rates up to 3 inches per hour.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The Northwest Avalanche Center has issued
a backcountry avalanche warning for the Stevens Pass Area.
Those with interest in the backcountry should consult with the
avalanche center message at https://www.nwac.us for additional
information. The warning is for backcountry terrain only and
does not apply to highways or ski areas.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST EARLY THIS MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING FOR THE CASCADE CREST INCLUDING HIGHWAY 2 BETWEEN COLES CORNER AND STEVENS PASS
